text: as Elizabeth half expected Mr. Bingley to do , he was able to bring Darcy with him to Longbourn before many days had passed after Lady Catherine ’s visit .
text_tokenized: as Elizabeth half expected Mr. Bingley to do , he was able to bring Darcy with him to Longbourn before many days had passed after Lady Catherine ’s visit .

text: The gentlemen arrived early ; and , before Mrs. Bennet had time to tell him of their having seen his aunt , of which her daughter sat in momentary dread , Bingley , who wanted to be alone with Jane , proposed their all walking out .
text_tokenized: The gentlemen arrived early ; and , before Mrs. Bennet had time to tell him of their having seen his aunt , of which her daughter sat in momentary dread , Bingley , who wanted to be alone with Jane , proposed their all walking out .

text: Bingley and Jane , however , soon allowed the others to outstrip them .
text_tokenized: Bingley and Jane , however , soon allowed the others to outstrip them .

text: They lagged behind , while Elizabeth , Kitty , and Darcy were to entertain each other .
text_tokenized: They lagged behind , while Elizabeth , Kitty , and Darcy were to entertain each other .

text: Very little was said by either ; Kitty was too much afraid of him to talk ; Elizabeth was secretly forming a desperate resolution ; and , perhaps , he might be doing the same .
text_tokenized: Very little was said by either ; Kitty was too much afraid of him to talk ; Elizabeth was secretly forming a desperate resolution ; and , perhaps , he might be doing the same .

text: They walked towards the Lucases ’ , because Kitty wished to call upon Maria ; and as Elizabeth saw no occasion for making it a general concern , when Kitty left them she went boldly on with him alone .
text_tokenized: They walked towards the Lucases ’ , because Kitty wished to call upon Maria ; and as Elizabeth saw no occasion for making it a general concern , when Kitty left them she went boldly on with him alone .

text: Now was the moment for her resolution to be executed ; and while her courage was high , she immediately said,-- “ Mr. Darcy , I am a very selfish creature , and for the sake of giving relief to my own feelings care not how much I may be wounding yours .
text_tokenized: Now was the moment for her resolution to be executed ; and while her courage was high , she immediately said,-- “ Mr. Darcy , I am a very selfish creature , and for the sake of giving relief to my own feelings care not how much I may be wounding yours .

text: I can no longer help thanking you for your unexampled kindness to my poor sister .
text_tokenized: I can no longer help thanking you for your unexampled kindness to my poor sister .

text: Ever since I have known it I have been most anxious to acknowledge to you how gratefully I feel it .
text_tokenized: Ever since I have known it I have been most anxious to acknowledge to you how gratefully I feel it .

text: Were it known to the rest of my family
text_tokenized: Were it known to the rest of my family

text: I should not have merely my own gratitude to express . ”
text_tokenized: I should not have merely my own gratitude to express . ”

text: “ I am sorry , exceedingly sorry , ” replied Darcy , in a tone of surprise and emotion , “ that you have ever been informed of what may , in a mistaken light , have given you uneasiness .
text_tokenized: “ I am sorry , exceedingly sorry , ” replied Darcy , in a tone of surprise and emotion , “ that you have ever been informed of what may , in a mistaken light , have given you uneasiness .

text: I did not think Mrs. Gardiner was so little to be trusted . ”
text_tokenized: I did not think Mrs. Gardiner was so little to be trusted . ”

text: “ You must not blame my aunt .
text_tokenized: “ You must not blame my aunt .

text: Lydia ’s thoughtlessness first betrayed to me that you had been concerned in the matter ; and , of course , I could not rest till I knew the particulars .
text_tokenized: Lydia ’s thoughtlessness first betrayed to me that you had been concerned in the matter ; and , of course , I could not rest till I knew the particulars .

text: Let me thank you again and again , in the name of all my family , for that generous compassion which induced you to take so much trouble , and bear so many mortifications , for the sake of discovering them . ”
text_tokenized: Let me thank you again and again , in the name of all my family , for that generous compassion which induced you to take so much trouble , and bear so many mortifications , for the sake of discovering them . ”

text: “ If you _ will _ thank me , ” he replied , “ let it be for yourself alone .
text_tokenized: “ If you _ will _ thank me , ” he replied , “ let it be for yourself alone .

text: That the wish of giving happiness to you might add force to the other inducements which led me on , I shall not attempt to deny .
text_tokenized: That the wish of giving happiness to you might add force to the other inducements which led me on , I shall not attempt to deny .

text: But your _ family _ owe me nothing .
text_tokenized: But your _ family _ owe me nothing .

text: Much as I respect them , I believe I thought only of _ you _ . ”
text_tokenized: Much as I respect them , I believe I thought only of _ you _ . ”

text: Elizabeth was too much embarrassed to say a word .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was too much embarrassed to say a word .

text: After a short pause , her companion added , “ You are too generous to trifle with me .
text_tokenized: After a short pause , her companion added , “ You are too generous to trifle with me .

text: If your feelings are still what they were last April , tell me so at once .
text_tokenized: If your feelings are still what they were last April , tell me so at once .

text: _ My _
text_tokenized: _ My _

text: affections and wishes are unchanged ; but one word from you will silence me on this subject for ever .
text_tokenized: affections and wishes are unchanged ; but one word from you will silence me on this subject for ever .

text: Elizabeth , feeling all the more than common awkwardness and anxiety of his situation , now forced herself to speak ; and immediately , though not very fluently , gave him to understand that her sentiments had undergone so material a change since the period to which he alluded , as to make her receive with gratitude and pleasure his present assurances .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , feeling all the more than common awkwardness and anxiety of his situation , now forced herself to speak ; and immediately , though not very fluently , gave him to understand that her sentiments had undergone so material a change since the period to which he alluded , as to make her receive with gratitude and pleasure his present assurances .

text: The happiness which this reply produced was such as he had probably never felt before ; and he expressed himself on the occasion as sensibly and as warmly as a man violently in love can be supposed to do .
text_tokenized: The happiness which this reply produced was such as he had probably never felt before ; and he expressed himself on the occasion as sensibly and as warmly as a man violently in love can be supposed to do .

text: Had Elizabeth been able to encounter his eyes , she might have seen how well the expression of heartfelt delight diffused over his face became him : but though she could not look she could listen ; and he told her of feelings which , in proving of what importance she was to him , made his affection every moment more valuable .
text_tokenized: Had Elizabeth been able to encounter his eyes , she might have seen how well the expression of heartfelt delight diffused over his face became him : but though she could not look she could listen ; and he told her of feelings which , in proving of what importance she was to him , made his affection every moment more valuable .

text: They walked on without knowing in what direction .
text_tokenized: They walked on without knowing in what direction .

text: There was too much to be thought , and felt , and said , for attention to any other objects .
text_tokenized: There was too much to be thought , and felt , and said , for attention to any other objects .

text: She soon learnt that they were indebted for their present good understanding to the efforts of his aunt , who _ did _ call on him in her return through London , and there relate her journey to Longbourn , its motive , and the substance of her conversation with Elizabeth ; dwelling emphatically on every expression of the latter , which , in her Ladyship ’s apprehension , peculiarly denoted her perverseness and assurance , in the belief that such a relation must assist her endeavours to obtain that promise from her nephew which _ she _ had refused to give .
text_tokenized: She soon learnt that they were indebted for their present good understanding to the efforts of his aunt , who _ did _ call on him in her return through London , and there relate her journey to Longbourn , its motive , and the substance of her conversation with Elizabeth ; dwelling emphatically on every expression of the latter , which , in her Ladyship ’s apprehension , peculiarly denoted her perverseness and assurance , in the belief that such a relation must assist her endeavours to obtain that promise from her nephew which _ she _ had refused to give .

text: But , unluckily for her Ladyship , its effect had been exactly contrariwise .
text_tokenized: But , unluckily for her Ladyship , its effect had been exactly contrariwise .

text: “ It taught me to hope , ” said he , “ as I had scarcely ever allowed myself to hope before .
text_tokenized: “ It taught me to hope , ” said he , “ as I had scarcely ever allowed myself to hope before .

text: I knew enough of your disposition to be certain , that had you been absolutely , irrevocably decided against me , you would have acknowledged it to Lady Catherine frankly and openly . ”
text_tokenized: I knew enough of your disposition to be certain , that had you been absolutely , irrevocably decided against me , you would have acknowledged it to Lady Catherine frankly and openly . ”

text: Elizabeth coloured and laughed as she replied , “ Yes , you know enough of my _ frankness _ to believe me capable of _ that _ .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth coloured and laughed as she replied , “ Yes , you know enough of my _ frankness _ to believe me capable of _ that _ .

text: After abusing you so abominably to your face , I could have no scruple in abusing you to all your relations . ” “ What did you say of me that I did not deserve ?
text_tokenized: After abusing you so abominably to your face , I could have no scruple in abusing you to all your relations . ” “ What did you say of me that I did not deserve ?

text: For though your accusations were ill - founded , formed on mistaken premises , my behaviour to you at the time had merited the severest reproof .
text_tokenized: For though your accusations were ill - founded , formed on mistaken premises , my behaviour to you at the time had merited the severest reproof .

text: It was unpardonable .
text_tokenized: It was unpardonable .

text: I can not think of it without abhorrence . ”
text_tokenized: I can not think of it without abhorrence . ”

text: “ We will not quarrel for the greater share of blame annexed to that evening , ” said Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ We will not quarrel for the greater share of blame annexed to that evening , ” said Elizabeth .

text: “ The conduct of neither , if strictly examined , will be irreproachable ; but since then we have both , I hope , improved in civility .
text_tokenized: “ The conduct of neither , if strictly examined , will be irreproachable ; but since then we have both , I hope , improved in civility .

text: “ I can not be so easily reconciled to myself .
text_tokenized: “ I can not be so easily reconciled to myself .

text: The recollection of what I then said , of my conduct , my manners , my expressions during the whole of it
text_tokenized: The recollection of what I then said , of my conduct , my manners , my expressions during the whole of it

text: , is now , and has been many months , inexpressibly painful to me .
text_tokenized: , is now , and has been many months , inexpressibly painful to me .

text: Your reproof , so well applied , I shall never forget : ‘ Had you behaved in a more gentlemanlike manner . ’
text_tokenized: Your reproof , so well applied , I shall never forget : ‘ Had you behaved in a more gentlemanlike manner . ’

text: Those were your words .
text_tokenized: Those were your words .

text: You know not , you can scarcely conceive , how they have tortured me ; though it was some time , I confess , before I was reasonable enough to allow their justice
text_tokenized: You know not , you can scarcely conceive , how they have tortured me ; though it was some time , I confess , before I was reasonable enough to allow their justice

text: “ I was certainly very far from expecting them to make so strong an impression .
text_tokenized: “ I was certainly very far from expecting them to make so strong an impression .

text: I had not the smallest idea of their being ever felt in such a way . ”
text_tokenized: I had not the smallest idea of their being ever felt in such a way . ”

text: “ I can easily believe it .
text_tokenized: “ I can easily believe it .

text: You thought me then devoid of every proper feeling , I am sure you did .
text_tokenized: You thought me then devoid of every proper feeling , I am sure you did .

text: The turn of your countenance I shall never forget , as you said that I could not have addressed you in any possible way that would induce you to accept me . ”
text_tokenized: The turn of your countenance I shall never forget , as you said that I could not have addressed you in any possible way that would induce you to accept me . ”

text: “ Oh , do not repeat what I then said .
text_tokenized: “ Oh , do not repeat what I then said .

text: These recollections will not do at all .
text_tokenized: These recollections will not do at all .

text: I assure you that I have long been most heartily ashamed of it . ”
text_tokenized: I assure you that I have long been most heartily ashamed of it . ”

text: Darcy mentioned his letter .
text_tokenized: Darcy mentioned his letter .

text: “ Did it , ” said he,--“did it _ soon _ make you think better of me ?
text_tokenized: “ Did it , ” said he,--“did it _ soon _ make you think better of me ?

text: Did you , on reading it , give any credit to its contents ? ”
text_tokenized: Did you , on reading it , give any credit to its contents ? ”

text: She explained what its effects on her had been , and how gradually all her former prejudices had been removed .
text_tokenized: She explained what its effects on her had been , and how gradually all her former prejudices had been removed .

text: “ I knew , ” said he , “ that what I wrote must give you pain , but it was necessary .
text_tokenized: “ I knew , ” said he , “ that what I wrote must give you pain , but it was necessary .

text: I hope you have destroyed the letter .
text_tokenized: I hope you have destroyed the letter .

text: There was one part , especially the opening of it , which I should dread your having the power of reading again .
text_tokenized: There was one part , especially the opening of it , which I should dread your having the power of reading again .

text: I can remember some expressions which might justly make you hate me . ”
text_tokenized: I can remember some expressions which might justly make you hate me . ”

text: “ The letter shall certainly be burnt , if you believe it essential to the preservation of my regard ; but , though we have both reason to think my opinions not entirely unalterable , they are not , I hope , quite so easily changed as that implies . ”
text_tokenized: “ The letter shall certainly be burnt , if you believe it essential to the preservation of my regard ; but , though we have both reason to think my opinions not entirely unalterable , they are not , I hope , quite so easily changed as that implies . ”

text: “ When I wrote that letter , ” replied Darcy , “ I believed myself perfectly calm and cool ; but I am since convinced that it was written in a dreadful bitterness of spirit . ”
text_tokenized: “ When I wrote that letter , ” replied Darcy , “ I believed myself perfectly calm and cool ; but I am since convinced that it was written in a dreadful bitterness of spirit . ”

text: “ The letter , perhaps , began in bitterness , but it did not end so .
text_tokenized: “ The letter , perhaps , began in bitterness , but it did not end so .

text: The adieu is charity itself .
text_tokenized: The adieu is charity itself .

text: But think no more of the letter .
text_tokenized: But think no more of the letter .

text: The feelings of the person who wrote and the person who received it are now so widely different from what they were then , that every unpleasant circumstance attending it ought to be forgotten .
text_tokenized: The feelings of the person who wrote and the person who received it are now so widely different from what they were then , that every unpleasant circumstance attending it ought to be forgotten .

text: You must learn some of my philosophy .
text_tokenized: You must learn some of my philosophy .

text: Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure . ”
text_tokenized: Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure . ”

text: “ I can not give you credit for any philosophy of the kind .
text_tokenized: “ I can not give you credit for any philosophy of the kind .

text: _ Your _ retrospections must be so totally void of reproach , that the contentment arising from them is not of philosophy , but , what is much better , of ignorance .
text_tokenized: _ Your _ retrospections must be so totally void of reproach , that the contentment arising from them is not of philosophy , but , what is much better , of ignorance .

text: But with _ me _ , it is not so .
text_tokenized: But with _ me _ , it is not so .

text: Painful recollections will intrude , which can not , which ought not to be repelled .
text_tokenized: Painful recollections will intrude , which can not , which ought not to be repelled .

text: I have been a selfish being all my life , in practice , though not in principle .
text_tokenized: I have been a selfish being all my life , in practice , though not in principle .

text: As a child
text_tokenized: As a child

text: I was taught what was _ right _ , but I was not taught to correct my temper .
text_tokenized: I was taught what was _ right _ , but I was not taught to correct my temper .

text: I was given good principles , but left to follow them in pride and conceit .
text_tokenized: I was given good principles , but left to follow them in pride and conceit .

text: Unfortunately an only son ( for many years an only _ child _ ) , I was spoiled by my parents , who , though good themselves , ( my father particularly , all that was benevolent and amiable , ) allowed , encouraged , almost taught me to be selfish and overbearing , to care for none beyond my own family circle , to think meanly of all the rest of the world , to _ wish _ at least to think meanly of their sense and worth compared with my own .
text_tokenized: Unfortunately an only son ( for many years an only _ child _ ) , I was spoiled by my parents , who , though good themselves , ( my father particularly , all that was benevolent and amiable , ) allowed , encouraged , almost taught me to be selfish and overbearing , to care for none beyond my own family circle , to think meanly of all the rest of the world , to _ wish _ at least to think meanly of their sense and worth compared with my own .

text: Such I was , from eight to eight - and - twenty ; and such I might still have been but for you , dearest , loveliest Elizabeth !
text_tokenized: Such I was , from eight to eight - and - twenty ; and such I might still have been but for you , dearest , loveliest Elizabeth !

text: What do I not owe you !
text_tokenized: What do I not owe you !

text: You taught me a lesson , hard indeed at first , but most advantageous .
text_tokenized: You taught me a lesson , hard indeed at first , but most advantageous .

text: By you , I was properly humbled .
text_tokenized: By you , I was properly humbled .

text: I came to you without a doubt of my reception .
text_tokenized: I came to you without a doubt of my reception .

text: You showed me how insufficient were all my pretensions to please a woman worthy of being pleased .
text_tokenized: You showed me how insufficient were all my pretensions to please a woman worthy of being pleased .

text: “ Had you then persuaded yourself that I should ? ” “ Indeed I had .
text_tokenized: “ Had you then persuaded yourself that I should ? ” “ Indeed I had .

text: What will you think of my vanity ?
text_tokenized: What will you think of my vanity ?

text: I believed you to be wishing , expecting my addresses . ”
text_tokenized: I believed you to be wishing , expecting my addresses . ”

text: “ My manners must have been in fault , but not intentionally , I assure you .
text_tokenized: “ My manners must have been in fault , but not intentionally , I assure you .

text: I never meant to deceive you , but my spirits might often lead me wrong .
text_tokenized: I never meant to deceive you , but my spirits might often lead me wrong .

text: How you must have hated me after _ that _ evening ! ”
text_tokenized: How you must have hated me after _ that _ evening ! ”

text: “ Hate you !
text_tokenized: “ Hate you !

text: I was angry , perhaps , at first , but my anger soon began to take a proper direction .
text_tokenized: I was angry , perhaps , at first , but my anger soon began to take a proper direction .

text: “ I am almost afraid of asking what you thought of me when we met at Pemberley .
text_tokenized: “ I am almost afraid of asking what you thought of me when we met at Pemberley .

text: You blamed me for coming ? ”
text_tokenized: You blamed me for coming ? ”

text: “ No , indeed , I felt nothing but surprise . ”
text_tokenized: “ No , indeed , I felt nothing but surprise . ”

text: “ Your surprise could not be greater than _ mine _ in being noticed by you .
text_tokenized: “ Your surprise could not be greater than _ mine _ in being noticed by you .

text: My conscience told me that I deserved no extraordinary politeness , and I confess that I did not expect to receive _ more _ than my due .
text_tokenized: My conscience told me that I deserved no extraordinary politeness , and I confess that I did not expect to receive _ more _ than my due .

text: “ My object _ then _ , ” replied Darcy , “ was to show you , by every civility in my power , that I was not so mean as to resent the past ; and I hoped to obtain your forgiveness , to lessen your ill opinion , by letting you see that your reproofs had been attended to .
text_tokenized: “ My object _ then _ , ” replied Darcy , “ was to show you , by every civility in my power , that I was not so mean as to resent the past ; and I hoped to obtain your forgiveness , to lessen your ill opinion , by letting you see that your reproofs had been attended to .

text: How soon any other wishes introduced themselves , I can hardly tell , but I believe in about half an hour after I had seen you .
text_tokenized: How soon any other wishes introduced themselves , I can hardly tell , but I believe in about half an hour after I had seen you .

text: He then told her of Georgiana ’s delight in her acquaintance , and of her disappointment at its sudden interruption ; which naturally leading to the cause of that interruption , she soon learnt that his resolution of following her from Derbyshire in quest of her sister had been formed before he quitted the inn , and that his gravity and thoughtfulness there had arisen from no other struggles than what such a purpose must comprehend .

text: She expressed her gratitude again , but it was too painful a subject to each to be dwelt on farther .
text_tokenized: She expressed her gratitude again , but it was too painful a subject to each to be dwelt on farther .

text: After walking several miles in a leisurely manner , and too busy to know anything about it , they found at last , on examining their watches , that it was time to be at home .
text_tokenized: After walking several miles in a leisurely manner , and too busy to know anything about it , they found at last , on examining their watches , that it was time to be at home .

text: “ What could have become of Mr. Bingley and Jane ? ” was a wonder which introduced the discussion of _ their _ affairs .
text_tokenized: “ What could have become of Mr. Bingley and Jane ? ” was a wonder which introduced the discussion of _ their _ affairs .

text: Darcy was delighted with their engagement ; his friend had given him the earliest information of it .
text_tokenized: Darcy was delighted with their engagement ; his friend had given him the earliest information of it .

text: “ I must ask whether you were surprised ? ” said Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ I must ask whether you were surprised ? ” said Elizabeth .

text: “ Not at all .
text_tokenized: “ Not at all .

text: When I went away , I felt that it would soon happen . ”
text_tokenized: When I went away , I felt that it would soon happen . ”

text: “ That is to say , you had given your permission .
text_tokenized: “ That is to say , you had given your permission .

text: I guessed as much . ”
text_tokenized: I guessed as much . ”

text: And though he exclaimed at the term , she found that it had been pretty much the case .
text_tokenized: And though he exclaimed at the term , she found that it had been pretty much the case .

text: “ On the evening before my going to London , ” said he , “ I made a confession to him , which I believe I ought to have made long ago .
text_tokenized: “ On the evening before my going to London , ” said he , “ I made a confession to him , which I believe I ought to have made long ago .

text: I told him of all that had occurred to make my former interference in his affairs absurd and impertinent .
text_tokenized: I told him of all that had occurred to make my former interference in his affairs absurd and impertinent .

text: His surprise was great .
text_tokenized: His surprise was great .

text: He had never had the slightest suspicion .
text_tokenized: He had never had the slightest suspicion .

text: I told him , moreover , that I believed myself mistaken in supposing , as I had done , that your sister was indifferent to him ; and as I could easily perceive that his attachment to her was unabated , I felt no doubt of their happiness together .
text_tokenized: I told him , moreover , that I believed myself mistaken in supposing , as I had done , that your sister was indifferent to him ; and as I could easily perceive that his attachment to her was unabated , I felt no doubt of their happiness together .

text: Elizabeth could not help smiling at his easy manner of directing his friend .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth could not help smiling at his easy manner of directing his friend .

text: “ Did you speak from your own observation , ” said she , “ when you told him that my sister loved him , or merely from my information last spring ? ”
text_tokenized: “ Did you speak from your own observation , ” said she , “ when you told him that my sister loved him , or merely from my information last spring ? ”

text: “ From the former .
text_tokenized: “ From the former .

text: I had narrowly observed her , during the two visits which I had lately made her here ; and I was convinced of her affection . ”
text_tokenized: I had narrowly observed her , during the two visits which I had lately made her here ; and I was convinced of her affection . ”

text: “ And your assurance of it , I suppose , carried immediate conviction to him . ” “ It did .
text_tokenized: “ And your assurance of it , I suppose , carried immediate conviction to him . ” “ It did .

text: Bingley is most unaffectedly modest .
text_tokenized: Bingley is most unaffectedly modest .

text: His diffidence had prevented his depending on his own judgment in so anxious a case , but his reliance on mine made everything easy .
text_tokenized: His diffidence had prevented his depending on his own judgment in so anxious a case , but his reliance on mine made everything easy .

text: I was obliged to confess one thing , which for a time , and not unjustly , offended him .
text_tokenized: I was obliged to confess one thing , which for a time , and not unjustly , offended him .

text: I could not allow myself to conceal that your sister had been in town three months last winter , that I had known it , and purposely kept it from him . He was angry .
text_tokenized: I could not allow myself to conceal that your sister had been in town three months last winter , that I had known it , and purposely kept it from him . He was angry .

text: But his anger , I am persuaded , lasted no longer than he remained in any doubt of your sister ’s sentiments .
text_tokenized: But his anger , I am persuaded , lasted no longer than he remained in any doubt of your sister ’s sentiments .

text: He has heartily forgiven me now .
text_tokenized: He has heartily forgiven me now .

text: Elizabeth longed to observe that Mr. Bingley had been a most delightful friend ; so easily guided that his worth was invaluable ; but she checked herself . She remembered that he had yet to learn to be laughed at , and it was rather too early to begin .

text_tokenized: In anticipating the happiness of Bingley , which of course was to be inferior only to his own

text_tokenized: LIX .

text: “ My dear Lizzy , where can you have been walking to ?
text_tokenized: “ My dear Lizzy , where can you have been walking to ?

text: ” was a question which Elizabeth received from Jane as soon as she entered the room , and from all the others when they sat down to table .
text_tokenized: ” was a question which Elizabeth received from Jane as soon as she entered the room , and from all the others when they sat down to table .

text: She had only to say in reply , that they had wandered about till she was beyond her own knowledge .
text_tokenized: She had only to say in reply , that they had wandered about till she was beyond her own knowledge .

text: She coloured as she spoke ; but neither that , nor anything else , awakened a suspicion of the truth .
text_tokenized: She coloured as she spoke ; but neither that , nor anything else , awakened a suspicion of the truth .

text: The evening passed quietly , unmarked by anything extraordinary .
text_tokenized: The evening passed quietly , unmarked by anything extraordinary .

text: The acknowledged lovers talked and laughed ; the unacknowledged were silent .
text_tokenized: The acknowledged lovers talked and laughed ; the unacknowledged were silent .

text: Darcy was not of a disposition in which happiness overflows in mirth ; and Elizabeth , agitated and confused , rather _ knew _ that she was happy than _ felt _ herself to be so ; for , besides the immediate embarrassment , there were other evils before her .
